His attempts to answer concerns about Google becoming Big Brother-like have yielded several foot-in-mouth moments. l In October, attendees at a forum organized by Atlantic Monthly heard him testify: We don't need you to type at all. We know where you are. We know where you've been. We can more or less know what you're thinking about. l In a CNN interview later that month, Eric Schmidt joked that users offended by photos of their homes showing up in Google's Street View mapping feature could "just move."
